films.title: A Day in the Life of Thomas Artimus OJones
films.synopsis: In a homage to one of the twentieth and twenty-first century's greatest singers, Tom Jones takes on the role of Thomas Artimus O'Jones and portrays a typical day in the young singer's life. Critics have said it is perhaps one of the most moving pieces of musical theatre ever portrayed on celluloid. Unfortunately for them it was filmed digitally
films.img: A Day in the Life of Thomas Artimus OJones.jpg

films.title: Captain Flask and the Lunchbox Kid
films.synopsis: Wonkymotion have done it again! Another classic from the stop motion studio
films.cast: Captain Flask, The Lunchbox Kid, Lost Souls
films.img: Captain Flask and the Lunchbox Kid.jpg
films.review:
Daily Splurge: 'Could this be the best film ever made?'
Daily Spiggot: 'No!'
The Bugle: 'BRILLIANT!!!!'
The Recorder: 'OUTSTANDINGLY OUTSTANDING'
The Rumourmonger: 'Citizen Kane eat your heart out'
The Jones Journal: 'Jolly good'
Neds News: 'Bizarre'
Lizzie''s Log: 'Looks lovely'
The Brief: 'At least it''s brief'
Candid Catalogue: 'Creepy'
The Tribune: 'Crawly'
New Scientist: 'Tragic'

films.title: Hair Today - Everyday Life with the Daleks
films.synopsis: Wonkymotion's first attempt at breaking into the lucrative Doctor Who franchise. we're sitting back waiting for the money to roll in...
films.img: Hair Today - Everyday Life with the Daleks.jpg
films.review: Awful, the entire thing ought to be exterminated

films.title: Thunderbirds
films.synopsis: A breakthrough piece heralded as a masterpiece by the critics. Longer, more accomplished. Wonkymotion are now telling a fuller story. The first film to be followed up with an outake reel (though there is only one clip). Note, the term 'masterpiece' is used in the loosest possible way. You may say masterpiece, but others would say dire.
films.review: Thunderbirds? No, Blunderbirds. They are beneath contempt

films.title: Where Eagles Dare
films.synopsis: An abridged but faithful version of the original using many of the original cast.
films.cast: Clint Eastwood, Richard Burton, Donald Trump
films.review: A triumph but only for those who have no experience of the real world!

films.title: Hairy Spotter and the Potion of Doom
films.synopsis: Wonkymotion have gone with the prevailing zeitgeist and are Proudly presenting their take on a wizard of a movie. Any similarities between factual or fictional wizards is purely coincidental.
films.cast: Hairy Spotter, Germione Grainger, Don Squeezely
films.img: Hairy Spotter and the Potion of Doom.jpg

films.title: Jurassic Park
films.synopsis: A revamp of the cinema classic. Wonkymotion style!
films.review: Revamp? Reverse Ramp more like. The film was terrible from start to finish. AVOID!

films.title: Mission Impossible
films.synopsis: A Homage to the 60's television programme
films.review: A Horrible Mess from start to finish

films.title: Star Trek - The Wonky Generation
films.synopsis: Jim, Splock and the rest of the crew are searching for the edge of the universe
films.review: Wonkymotion's first full scale movie making use of many new technical features including, for the first time, Green Screen! The anticipated critical acclaim so desired by all in the production team never actually came to anything. Instead the film was panned.  'Utter dross', 'Painful to watch', 'Where's my supper' and the traditional Eastend cry of 'Leeeve it aaoort' were typical quotes of the time. Hurt and dejected, the crew turned to drink and wanton debauchery. It was a dark time alleviated only by the consumption of large amounts of chocolate.
